climbs.name: Wonder Dog
climbs.fa: Lead  Micah Richard, Kevin the neighbor. Sept 11, 2016

content.description:
Climb left leaning crack until it is possible to traverse right onto the clean face. Move up past 3 bolts and 3 horizontal cracks, to an interesting top out.  The thin crux moves are between the first and second bolt.  Fairly sustained and excellent. 

  Jeff's variation; After second horizontal head a bit to the left following weaknesses to top. T.R. only.  5.10 a
content.protection: Mixed gear. 3 bolts. All three horizontal cracks are about the same size, and take excellent gear. Bring Cams from 1/2'' to 1''. With doubles of .3 and .4 BD or equivalent, plus something for the left leaning crack at the start.
content.location: Up the center of the clean face that looks like a giant keystone.

content.description: Follow diagonal crack to the top.
content.protection: Standard trad rig. A bit run out near the top, due to flaring nature of crack.
content.location: Crack that starts on the left side of the alcove.

content.description: Follow a series of intermittent parallel vertical cracks which lean right.
content.protection: Standard rack. The rock / crack  quality is a bit suspect near the ground, Better pro as you climb higher.
content.location: 5 feet left of the narrow chimney.

content.description: Climb the crack which becomes a narrow chimney.
content.location: Just right of Tracker and Kody

content.description: Start in the 6 foot high alcove and follow a 3-4 inch crack up to top.
content.protection: Standard trad rack. some bigger cams helpful.
content.location: The wide crack just to the right the clean face.

content.description: At the center of the alcove, climb a short broken crack on the right then up the face without using the wide crack on the right.
The tallest most appealing area of Athena Rock. Several interesting crack climbs and some high quality face climbing on mostly clean rock.  Most route descriptions written by Al Carilli.
